p: We compared the MIC/MFC of O. vulgare with existing value for fluconazole (0.25%)[ 36] and it was observed that the MIC/MFC of O. vulgare (0.024% and 0.097%) was much lower. The MIC of O. vulgare (0.024%) which was determined in our study is in par with a study carried out by Hammer et al.,[ 37] wherein it was found to be 0.03% against C. albicans. In a study by Xu et al.,[ 38] MIC of fluconazole was found to be 125 times more in azole-resistant C. albicans than in susceptible C. albicans. The present experimental herb O. vulgare showed much lesser MIC/MFC as compared to fluconazole indicating that the herb can be effective even in a lower dose of MIC/MFC. In a comparative study by Lambert et al.,[ 39] they also observed that O. vulgare had a total inhibitory effect on the pathogens involved. However, their study was against bacteria and not the fungi affecting human beings.
